definition: lit. lovely scene of blossoming plants swaying in the breeze (idiom)/fig. gorgeously dressed (woman)
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
branch/classifier for sticks, rods, pencils etc
to recruit/to provoke/to beckon/to incur/to infect/contagious/a move (chess)/a maneuver/device/trick/to confess
to spread out/to open up/to exhibit/to put into effect/to postpone/to prolong/exhibition

sentences.english: She dresses up fit to kill even to go out shopping.
sentences.chinese: 她甚至出外购物，也打扮得花枝招展。
她总是打扮得花枝招展。

sentences.english: She doesn't love dressing up, this makes her in beautiful, very thin.
sentences.chinese: 她不爱打扮，这又使她在花枝招展中，格外单薄。

sentences.english: She likes get gussied up and goes to a dancing patty.
sentences.chinese: 她喜欢打扮得花枝招展的去参加舞会。

sentences.english: I am wearing simple dress everyday, stand in be gorgeously dressed among them.
sentences.chinese: 我每天穿着朴素的衣服，站在花枝招展的她们中间。

sentences.english: She dolled herself up as though she was a girl of eighteen.
sentences.chinese: 她打扮得花枝招展，好像是个十八岁的姑娘似的。

sentences.english: It does not have to be pretty to be beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 美并不一定是要花枝招展。

sentences.english: She is well dressed up but nowhere to go .
sentences.chinese: 她打扮得花枝招展，却无处可去。

definition: to apply makeup conspicuously (idiom)/dressed to the nines and wearing makeup
to decorate/to dress/to make up/to adorn/manner of dressing/style of dress
variant of 裝扮|装扮[zhuang1 ban4]
middle-aged but still attractive woman/lady of a certain age
richly bedecked/dripping with gold and silver (idiom)
(of a girl) in the prime of youth
(of a flower) to attract bees and butterflies/(fig.) to attract the opposite sex/to flirt
